title: The Witches
description: A young boy and his Norwegian grandmother battle the Grand High Witch in Roald Dahl's classic story.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: A science fiction novel that blends the horrors of World War II with surreal elements, following Billy Pilgrim’s experiences.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
description: Harry's fourth year at Hogwarts involves a deadly competition and a rising dark power.

title: War and Peace
description: A vast epic centered around the events of the Napoleonic Wars and the lives affected by it.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's timeless romantic novel about Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: Dostoevsky's psychological masterpiece about crime, guilt, and redemption.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: The story of seven generations of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: To the Lighthouse
description: A novel exploring themes of loss, subjectivity, and time, centered around the Ramsay family.

title: The War of the Worlds
description: H.G. Wells' classic tale of Martian invasion and human survival.

title: Kafka on the Shore
description: A surreal exploration of memory, consciousness, and fate, blending magical realism and Japanese folklore.

title: The House of the Spirits
description: The life and loves of the Trueba family, tracing four generations of political and personal struggles.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
description: A detective mystery featuring Hercule Poirot, set on a luxurious European train.

title: The Shining
description: A chilling story about a family staying in a haunted hotel during the winter season.

title: The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
description: Prequel to the Hunger Games, focusing on Coriolanus Snow as a young man.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: A Harvard professor uncovers a conspiracy hidden within works of art and religious texts.

title: The Almost Moon
description: A dark novel about a daughter confronting her difficult relationship with her mother.

title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: The story of Huck Finn and his adventures along the Mississippi River.

title: Great Expectations
description: The journey of young Pip, an orphan, through growth and development into adulthood.

title: The Hobbit
description: The prequel to Lord of the Rings, telling the story of Bilbo Baggins' adventures.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women have lost most of their rights.

title: The Trial
description: A nightmarish, surreal novel about a man arrested and prosecuted by a mysterious authority.

title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
description: Maya Angelou's autobiography recounting her early life and experiences with racism and identity.

title: Beloved
description: A powerful novel about an escaped slave and the haunting presence of her dead child.

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian novel about a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them.

title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic novel where technological advancements control every aspect of human life.

title: A Game of Thrones
description: The first book in the Song of Ice and Fire series, exploring the power struggles in Westeros.

title: Never Let Me Go
description: A dystopian novel about clones raised for organ donation, grappling with their fate.

title: American Gods
description: A story blending ancient mythology and modern America, following Shadow and his mysterious employer.

title: The Alchemist
description: A spiritual quest across the desert in search of treasure and deeper meaning.

title: Blood Meridian
description: A violent and philosophical novel about a young man's journey with a murderous gang in the American West.

title: The Witcher: Sword of Destiny
description: A collection of short stories following Geralt of Rivia, a monster hunter in a world of magic and danger.

title: Drive Your Plow Over the Bones of the Dead
description: A mysterious tale of an elderly woman and a series of deaths in a small Polish village.

title: The Tell-Tale Heart
description: A classic short story of psychological horror, narrating a murderer's descent into madness.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A gothic novel about a man whose portrait ages instead of him, reflecting his moral corruption.

title: The Sound and the Fury
description: A complex narrative of the fall of a Southern family, told in multiple perspectives.
Orwell’s dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and the dangers of government surveillance.

title: A Farewell to Arms
description: A love story set during World War I, following an American ambulance driver and a British nurse.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's classic novel about teenage rebellion, following the troubled Holden Caulfield as he wanders New York City.

title: Franny and Zooey
description: A story about the members of the Glass family and their spiritual journeys, written with Salinger's unique narrative voice.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about race, injustice, and moral growth in the American South, as seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: Go Set a Watchman
description: A sequel to 'To Kill a Mockingbird', this novel follows Scout Finch as an adult returning to her hometown of Maycomb, Alabama, where she must grapple with personal and societal changes.

title: White Teeth
description: Zadie Smith's debut novel, a sprawling multicultural epic set in London, weaving together the lives of two families over several decades.

title: On Beauty
description: A novel about family dynamics, identity, and the clash between liberal and conservative values, loosely inspired by E.M. Forster's 'Howard's End'.
